definition[0]: the period of time in which you will make a profit on an investment
definition[1]: the period of time over which you must pay back money you have borrowed
definition[2]: the time it takes for the profit from an investment to equal the amount of money invested in it
example[0]: The project has a payback period of two years.
definition[3]: the amount of time over which you are allowed to pay back a loan
example[1]: The longer the payback period, the more interest you pay on the loan.
